issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Turn off CBO for hive.support.special.characters.tablename tests until feature is complete

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: analyze table compute stats for table with special characters will wipe out all the table stats

ATTACHMENT ID: 12773804 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
The test case failures are unrelated. [~ashutoshc], could you please take a look? Thanks.
Now that we have removed CounterStats we dont need any prefix/hashing/encoding/Path Separator business. We can get rid of all of that logic and make code more readable.

I have removed hashing and also a configuration for the max length of prefix. But for encoding, I think we still need that because we need to escape the "/" otherwise the location in HDFS will be wrong. The path separator problem is mainly due to the Utilities.join(String... elements). The elements may or may not contain path separator. It is a consistency problem and it is not that simple as I investigated. I think it is worth another JIRA to fix it. What do you think [~ashutoshc]?
